title: Jeff_Baena
extract: Jeffrey Baena was an American screenwriter and film director. He wrote and directed Life After Beth (2014), Joshy (2016), The Little Hours (2017), Horse Girl (2020) and Spin Me Round (2022) and co-wrote I Heart Huckabees (2004). He was known for his frequent collaborations with actresses Alison Brie, Molly Shannon, and Aubrey Plaza.
trendingreason:
On #2025-01-06 11:16:27.275303, Jeff_Baena's Wikipedia article may be trending due to the release of his latest film "Spin Me Round" in early 2022 and renewed interest from fans who might have been celebrating or discussing Baena's career highlights such as collaborations with notable actresses like Alison Brie, Molly Shannon, and Aubrey Plaza.

title: Aubrey_Plaza
extract: Aubrey Christina Plaza is an American actress, comedian, and producer. She began acting in local theater productions as a teenager and performed improv and sketch comedy at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre. After graduating from New York University Tisch School of the Arts, Plaza made her feature film debut in Mystery Team (2009) and gained wide recognition for her role as April Ludgate on the NBC political satire sitcom Parks and Recreation (2009–2015).
trendingreason: Aubrey_Plaza's Wikipedia page might be trending due to a recent feature film or television project she has been involved in, renewed interest from fans of her work on "Parks and Rec," an anniversary celebration related to the show, or coverage by popular entertainment news outlets.

title: The_Vivienne
extract: James Lee Williams, known professionally as The Vivienne, was a British drag performer, known for being appointed as the UK drag ambassador in 2015 for American reality television series RuPaul's Drag Race. They later competed in and won the first series of RuPaul's Drag Race UK in 2019, and competed again in the seventh season of RuPaul's Drag Race All Stars in 2022. They became the first drag performer to compete on Dancing on Ice in 2023, appearing as a contestant on the fifteenth series, in which they finished in third place.
trendingreason: The Vivienne article might be trending due to their historic achievement of competing against professional dancers in RuPaul's Drag Race All Stars and subsequently performing alongside them in Dancing on Ice as the first drag performer ever featured on the show, reflecting a milestone moment for LGBT representation within mainstream media.

title: Squid_Game_season_2
extract: The second season of the South Korean dystopian survival thriller television series Squid Game, marketed as Squid Game 2, is created by Korean television producer and writer Hwang Dong-hyuk. It was released on Netflix on December 26, 2024. The season stars Lee Jung-jae, Lee Byung-hun, Im Si-wan, Kang Ha-neul, Wi Ha-joon, Park Gyu-young, Lee Jin-wook, Park Sung-hoon, Yang Dong-geun, Kang Ae-shim, and Jo Yu-ri.
trendingreason: The second season of the critically acclaimed Korean series "Squid Game," which features a star-studded cast including Lee Jung-jae and Kim Ok-Bae'in addition to previous actors from the original series, has attracted significant attention on Wikipedia as it was released globally by Netflix in December 2024. The trending article reflects viewers’ fascination with its unique premise of survival games during a time of economic crisis and fans seeking updates about cast members' involvement since the series had an unexpected hiatus before airing, leading to heightened speculation on social media platforms like Twitter using hashtags such as #SquidGame2.

title: Brothers_Home
extract: The Brothers' Home was an internment camp located in Busan, South Korea during the 1970s and 1980s. The facility contained 20 factories and housed thousands of people, including homeless people and children taken from the streets, and along with student protesters who opposed the government. Only 10% of internees were actually homeless. The camp was home to some of the worst human rights abuses in South Korea during the period and has been nicknamed "Korea's Auschwitz" by various Korean media outlets.
trendingreason: The Brothers_Home article might be trending on Wikipedia due to heightened global awareness and discussion regarding historical atrocities, human rights abuses in South Korea during the '70s-'80s era of internment camps for political dissidents like student protesters - a topic relevantly covered by recent anniversaries or commemorative events.

title: Nosferatu_(2024_film)
extract: Nosferatu is a 2024 American supernatural horror film written and directed by Robert Eggers. It is a remake of F. W. Murnau's 1922 silent film Nosferatu, itself inspired by Bram Stoker's 1897 novel Dracula. The film stars Bill Skarsgård as the titular character and Nicholas Hoult and Lily-Rose Depp as the married Hutter couple, with Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Emma Corrin, Ralph Ineson, Simon McBurney, and Willem Dafoe in supporting roles.
trendingreason:
The Nosferatu_(2024_film) article might be trending on Wikipedia due to its status as a highly anticipated remake of the iconic silent horror film by F. W. Murnau (1922), and interest spikes in retellings or adaptations, combined with celebrity cast inclusions like Bill Skarsgård and Aaron Taylor-Johnson which can draw social media attention on January 6th following the release date of a major Hollywood film project's announcement.

title: Squid_Game
extract: Squid Game is a South Korean dystopian survival thriller television series created, written and directed by Hwang Dong-hyuk for Netflix. The series revolves around a secret contest where 456 players, all of whom are in deep financial hardship, risk their lives to play a series of deadly children's games for the chance to win a ₩45.6 billion prize. The series' title draws from ojingeo ("squid"), a Korean children's game. Lee Jung-jae leads an ensemble cast.
trendingreason: The Squid_Game article might be trending on Wikipedia due to its massive international popularity, as the South Korean dystopian survival thriller series has captivated audiences worldwide with its unique concept and high stakes children's games for financial redemption. The show was renewed for a second season which could also contribute to increased public interest reflected in Wikipedia searches on that date.

title: Human_metapneumovirus
extract: Human metapneumovirus is a negative-sense single-stranded RNA virus of the family Pneumoviridae and is closely related to the Avian metapneumovirus (AMPV) subgroup C. It was isolated for the first time in 2001 in the Netherlands by using the RAP-PCR technique for identification of unknown viruses growing in cultured cells. As of 2016, it was the second most common cause of acute respiratory tract illness in otherwise-healthy children under the age of 5 in a large US outpatient clinic.
trendingreason: Human_metapneumovirus is trending on Wikipedia as of January 6, 2025, likely due to increased public interest following its identification and growing recognition for being a significant cause of acute respiratory illness in young children under five years old within the US.

title: Jimmy_Carter
extract: James Earl Carter Jr. was the 39th president of the United States, serving from 1977 to 1981. A member of the Democratic Party, Carter served as the 76th governor of Georgia from 1971 to 1975 and in the Georgia State Senate from 1963 to 1967. He was the longest-lived president in U.S. history and the first to reach the age of 100.
trendingreason: The Jimmy Carter article might be trending on Wikipedia due to his historic milestone as the oldest living former President, recently reaching the age of 100, which has captivated public interest in reflecting upon American political history and leadership longevity. Additionally, anniversaries or special events related to his presidency could spur a resurgence of articles about Jimmy Carter on Wikipedia.

title: Pushpa_2:_The_Rule
extract: Pushpa 2: The Rule is a 2024 Indian Telugu-language action drama film directed by Sukumar and produced by Mythri Movie Makers, in association with Sukumar Writings. The film stars Allu Arjun in the titular role, alongside Rashmika Mandanna, Fahadh Faasil, Jagapathi Babu, Jagadeesh Prathap Bandari, Dhananjaya, Rao Ramesh, Sunil, Anasuya Bharadwaj and Ajay. It is the second instalment of the Pushpa film series and the sequel to Pushpa: The Rise (2021). The film follows Pushpa Raj, a coolie risen to the ranks of sandalwood smuggler, who begins to face tough opposition from enemies, including SP Bhanwar Singh Shekhawat IPS.
trendingreason: The Pushpa_2:_The_Rule Wikipedia article might be trending due to its release on January 6, 2024, featuring A-list actors Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna in a high-octane action drama that serves as the sequel to popular films within the series.
